Class Job

java.lang.Object
WorkLoad.Job
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable
public class Job extends Object implements Comparable
Represents an executable Job derived from a Task in the workload.

A Job encapsulates release/deadline times, remaining work (target/progress), priority handling (original/current/inherited), critical section sets and runtime placement information such as assigned core/processor. Inline Chinese comments in the original source are integrated into this Javadoc (for example: comments explaining that a Job is blocked by a single resource at a time, and that migrateTo must be called before the core runs).

The class implements Comparable to allow ordering in ready queues according to current priority and tiebreak rules (inheritance and release time are considered).

Author:
ShiuJia

    • isInherit

      public boolean isInherit
      Whether this job has inherited priority

    • isSuspended

      public boolean isSuspended
      Whether this job is suspended

  • Constructor Details

    • Job

      public Job()
      Create an empty Job with default, zeroed or null fields. Consumers should set the task, timing and workload values before use.

  • Method Details

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo(Object o)
      Compare this Job to another for queue ordering.

      Jobs are ordered primarily by current priority (higher value means higher scheduling precedence). Ties are broken by inheritance status (inherited jobs win) and then by earlier release time.

      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface Comparable
      Parameters:
      o - another Job to compare
      Returns:
      negative if this has higher scheduling precedence, positive if lower, zero if equal
      Throws:
      ClassCastException - if o is not a Job

    • execute

      public void execute(double executionTime, long curTime)
      Execute a portion of this job when there is remaining work larger than the provided execution quantum.

      If this is the first execution (progressAmount == 0) the pending time is set based on current time minus release time. The blocking resource is cleared and progress is advanced by executionTime.

      Parameters:
      executionTime - amount of work/time to execute (same units as targetAmount)
      curTime - the current global time used to compute pending time when needed

    • finalExecute

      public void finalExecute()
      Complete the job by setting progress to the target amount.

      Called when remaining work is less than the usual execution quantum; it clears the blocking resource and marks the job as fully progressed.

    • lockSharedResource

      public void lockSharedResource(SharedResource sr)
      Lock the next not-entered critical section on the provided shared resource and move it into the entered stack.
      Parameters:
      sr - the SharedResource to lock

    • unLockSharedResource

      public void unLockSharedResource(SharedResource sr)
      Unlock a shared resource and pop the most recent entered critical section from the entered stack.
      Parameters:
      sr - the SharedResource to unlock

    • raisePriority

      public void raisePriority(Priority p, int i)
      Increase this job's priority by creating and setting a higher Priority instance derived from the provided one.
      Parameters:
      p - the Priority value prompting the raise
      i - additional offset used when computing the raised priority

    • inheritPriority

      public void inheritPriority(Priority p)
      Apply priority inheritance from another job's priority.

      This method computes an inherited priority and sets it if superior to the current one. If the job is not suspended the current priority is updated immediately.

      Parameters:
      p - the priority to inherit from

    • endInheritance

      public void endInheritance()
      End any active priority inheritance and restore the original priority if appropriate.

    • recoverInheritance

      public void recoverInheritance()
      Re-evaluate inheritance state after changes to entered critical sections and possibly re-apply inheritance from waiting jobs.

    • showInfo

      public void showInfo()
      Print debug information about this job to the simulator output.

      Includes release time, deadline, target amount and the list of not-entered critical sections with their relative times.

    • setID

      public void setID(int id)
      Set the job identifier.
      Parameters:
      id - the integer ID for this job

    • setPriorityLevel

      public void setPriorityLevel(int priorityLevel)
      Set the numeric priority level for external use.
      Parameters:
      priorityLevel - the integer priority level

      public void setCriticalityLevel(Long criticalityLevel)
      Set the job's criticality level.
      Parameters:
      criticalityLevel - the criticality level value

    • setParentTask

      public void setParentTask(Task t)
      Associate this job with its parent Task.
      Parameters:
      t - the parent Task

    • setReleaseTime

      public void setReleaseTime(long t)
      Set the release time for the job and initialize the time-of-status.
      Parameters:
      t - the absolute release time

      public void setAbsoluteDeadline(long d)
      Set the absolute deadline and initialize response/pending time estimates based on the release time.
      Parameters:

      Parameters:

      public void setCurrentProiority(Priority p)
      Update the current priority and refresh the job's position in ready queues if it is present.
      Parameters:
      p - the new current Priority to assign

      public void setOriginCore(Core c)
      Set the original core where the job was first allocated.
      Parameters:

    • setCurrentCore

      public void setCurrentCore(Core c)
      Update the currently assigned core for this job.
      Parameters:

    • setLocalProcessor

      public void setLocalProcessor(Processor p)
      Set the local processor reference for this job (used for global ready queue).
      Parameters:
      p - the Processor that owns the global ready queue

    • setCriticalSectionSet

      public void setCriticalSectionSet(CriticalSectionSet css)
      Populate this job's critical section collections from a CriticalSectionSet.

      Adds each CriticalSection to both the full set and the not-entered priority queue, and records the used shared resources.

      Parameters:
      css - the CriticalSectionSet to import

      Parameters:

    • setStatus

      public void setStatus(Definition.JobStatus sta, long time)
      Update job status and apply bookkeeping side-effects (completed/miss counters).

      When marking COMPLETED or MISSDEADLINE this method updates the parent task counters and notifies attached SchedulingInfo records of the new completed/missed totals.

      Parameters:
      sta - the new JobStatus value
      time - the time at which the status change occurs

    • getStatusString

      public String getStatusString()
      Return a human-readable status string for reporting purposes.
      Returns:
      a string describing the current JobStatus

    • getStatus

      public Definition.JobStatus getStatus()
      Return the current JobStatus enum value.
      Returns:
      the JobStatus

    • setTimeOfStatus

      public void setTimeOfStatus(long time)
      Set the internal timestamp for when the job entered its current status.
      Parameters:
      time - the time of status change

    • getTimeOfStatus

      public String getTimeOfStatus()
      Return a formatted representation of the time the job entered its current status.

      If timeOfStatus is non-zero it is formatted using the global magnification factor; otherwise the last scheduling info end time is used.

      Returns:
      formatted time-of-status string

    • setResponseTime

      public void setResponseTime(long time)
      Set the measured response time for this job.
      Parameters:
      time - the response time to assign

      Returns:
      the response time

      public void setPendingTime(long time)
      Set the pending (waiting) time for this job.
      Parameters:
      time - the pending time to assign

    • getPendingTime

      public long getPendingTime()
      Return the pending (waiting) time for this job.
      Returns:
      the pending time

    • migrateTo

      public boolean migrateTo(Core nextCore)
      Request migration of this job to another core.

      This method should be called before the core begins running; it enqueues migration costs on the source and destination cores and updates the job's current core reference. Returns true when migration was scheduled.

      Parameters:
      nextCore - the Core to migrate to
      Returns:
      true if migration was scheduled, false otherwise

    • setBeBlockedTime

      public void setBeBlockedTime(long l)
      Increment the total time this job has been blocked by resources.
      Parameters:
      l - the amount of time to add to beBlockedTime

    • getBeBlockedTime

      public long getBeBlockedTime()
      Return the accumulated time this job was blocked.
      Returns:
      blocked time total

    • getBeBlockedTimeRatio

      public double getBeBlockedTimeRatio()
      Return the ratio of blocked time to task period (useful for analysis).
      Returns:
      the blocked time ratio

    • setSuspended

      public void setSuspended(boolean b)
      Suspend or resume the job; when suspended it receives the special priority Definition.Ohm. When resumed, original or inherited priority is restored as appropriate.
      Parameters:
      b - true to suspend, false to resume

    • getBlockingResource

      public SharedResource getBlockingResource()
      Return the resource currently blocking this job, if any.
      Returns:
      the blocking SharedResource, or null

    • setBlockingResource

      public void setBlockingResource(SharedResource r)
      Set or clear the resource currently blocking this job.
      Parameters:
      r - the SharedResource causing blocking, or null to clear
